alert.note: Alert for Benewah (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 14 at 3:55AM MDT until June 16 at 6:03AM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of North Idaho, including the following counties, Benewah and Latah. * WHEN...Until 400 PM PDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and creeks. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 254 AM PDT, small streams continue to run high. This is causing small stream flooding. Rapid river rises have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen with additional amounts up to a quarter inch expected today. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
